intro: Burbidgea schizocheila, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant has woody stems and hairy leaves adapted to withstand hot, dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Burbidgea schizocheila is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
